notes.text:
An update for Red Hat Data Grid is now available.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Data Grid is a distributed, in-memory, NoSQL datastore based on the Infinispan project.

This release of Red Hat Data Grid 7.3.4 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Data Grid 7.3.3 and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are described in the Release Notes, linked to in the References section of this erratum.

Security Fix(es):

* wildfly-core: Incorrect privileges for 'Monitor', 'Auditor' and 'Deployer' user by default (CVE-2019-14838)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Data Grid 7.3.4 security update

notes.text: It was found that Wildfly users had default user permissions set incorrectly. A malicious user could use this flaw to access unauthorized controls for the application server.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: wildfly-core: Incorrect privileges for 'Monitor', 'Auditor' and 'Deployer' user by default
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
To install this update, do the following:

1. Download the Data Grid 7.3.4 server patch from the customer portal.
2. Back up your existing Data Grid installation. You should back up databases, configuration files, and so on.
3. Install the Data Grid 7.3.4 server patch. Refer to the 7.3 Release Notes for patching instructions.
4. Restart Data Grid to ensure the changes take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: wildfly-core: Incorrect privileges for 'Monitor', 'Auditor' and 'Deployer' user by default
